commit_message:
Adds VM connectivity check after advanced VM operations

The advanced VM operations are:
   * Stop/Start an instance
   * Reboot an instance
   * Rebuild an instance
   * Pause/Unpause an instance
   * Suspend/Resume an instance
   * Resize an instance

This is a proposal for a tempest network scenario
aimed at validating VM connectivity after advanced
VM operations.

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-advanced-scenarios

Change-Id: If9e658147a1fe89e3681f1309e863b901d282447
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/07/59907/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common.utils import data_utils def _check_same_net_vms_connectivity(self): if not self.config.network.tenant_networks_reachable: msg = 'Tenant networks not configured to be reachable.' LOG.info(msg) return if not self.networks: self._create_networks() network = self.networks[-1] test_servers = [] for i in range(2): name = data_utils.rand_name('server-smoke-%d-' % i) test_servers.append(self._create_server(name, network)) ssh_login = self.config.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = self.keypairs[self.tenant_id].private_key ips = [] for server in test_servers: for net_name, ip_addresses in server.networks.iteritems(): for ip_address in ip_addresses: self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) ips.append(ip_address) self.assertTrue(self._ping_ip_address_from_vm(ips[0], ssh_login, private_key, ips[1]), "Timed out to ping " "%(dest_ip)s from VM which IP is %(source_ip)s" % {"dest_ip": ips[1], "source_ip": ips[0]}) self.assertTrue(self._ping_ip_address_from_vm(ips[1], ssh_login, private_key, ips[0]), "Timed out to ping " "%(dest_ip)s from VM which IP is %(source_ip)s" % {"dest_ip": ips[0], "source_ip": ips[1]}) self._check_same_net_vms_connectivity()

subject: Add missing trunk segment type option for profile create
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 20:56:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6f5bea06736574e986f82966cdf8f73568da5380', 'message': "Add missing trunk segment type option for profile create

The Cisco N1K plugin allows for 'trunk' type network profiles to
be created in addition to existing 'vlan' and 'overlay' types.
This fix is to add to the segment_type choices in forms.py to
include the missing 'trunk' choice. Additionally the description
message has been updated and new unit tests added.

Change-Id: Ifc6d2952f2e37d6757fe7a432cffdb8fe36ffc61
Closes-bug: #1285298

commit_message:
Add missing trunk segment type option for profile create

The Cisco N1K plugin allows for 'trunk' type network profiles to
be created in addition to existing 'vlan' and 'overlay' types.
This fix is to add to the segment_type choices in forms.py to
include the missing 'trunk' choice. Additionally the description
message has been updated to make sure strings are uniform in all
locations. The help string for the multicast range has also been
updated to reflect a valid mcast IP and finally new unit tests
have been added.

Closes-bug: #1285298

Change-Id: Ifc6d2952f2e37d6757fe7a432cffdb8fe36ffc61

commit_message:
Improve demographics text

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/activity-board refs/changes/02/82302/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
Attraction / retention

Attracted: Number of contributors entering the project for each cohort. In charts, cohorts are organized by "age" (time since they entered the project), each bar representing one of these cohorts. Large bars for any age mean that the community was attracting many contributors that time ago. Retained: Number of remaining contributors (those still active) for each cohort. Large top bars (corresponding to older cohorts) mean that experienced contributors are still active. Large bottom bars mean that new contributors are being retained.

The ratio between retained and attracted contributors for a cohort represents the retention ratio for that cohort (fraction of contributors of that age that are still active).
deleted_lines:
Information about demography

Aging: charts show the age of the contributors still active using the date of their first contribution in the different data sources. Big bars on top would mean that old contributors are still active. Big bars at the bottom would mean that new contributors are being retained.

Birth charts show the number of contributors joining the community. Biggers bars on top would mean that your community attracted more people. Bigger bars at the bottom would mean that your community is attracting more people lately.

commit_message:
Add UNSHELVING and RESCUING into IoOPSFilter consideration state

OopsFilter will take instance in following state
task_states.RESIZE_MIGRATING, task_states.REBUILDING, task_states.RESIZE_PREP,
task_states.IMAGE_SNAPSHOT, task_states.IMAGE_BACKUP
into consideration ,if the instance on this host exceed the maximum
number of instance allowed to do I/O the scheduler will fail on the host

UNSHELVING and RESCUING are also I/O related so IoOps need to include them

Change-Id: I5081b5e63ec4b5cbc310ff5283d4fdb1a3bb87d0
Closes-Bug: #1295558

commit_message:
Updated both oslo.messaging and deprecated instructions for glance and cinder configs

Change-Id: I9f6f1bdb73ab6836ea4f31dd3ac01fc9a5511128
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/71/82271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Glance to send notifications to the bus. Update the following in glance-api.conf and restart the service - :: rpc_backend = glance.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu notification_driver = messaging rabbit_notification_exchange = glance Following is deprecated - :: notifier_strategy = rabbit Cinder to send notifications to the bus. Update the following in cinder.conf and restart the service - :: rpc_backend = glance.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu notification_driver = messaging # Time period must be hour, day, month or year volume_usage_audit_period=hour control_exchange=cinder Following is deprecated - :: notification_driver=cinder.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier cinder_volume_usage_audit_period=hour You may also need to setup the following cron job to generate usage notifications for volumes existing during the audit period. :: 5 * * * * /usr/bin/cinder-volume-usage-audit >/dev/null 2>&1
deleted_lines: Glance to send notifications to the bus by changing ``notifier_strategy`` to ``rabbit`` or ``qpid`` in ``glance-api.conf`` and restarting the service. Cinder to send notifications to the bus by changing ``notification_driver`` to ``cinder.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier`` and ``control_exchange`` to ``cinder``, before restarting the service.

added_lines: Glance to send notifications to the bus. Update the following in glance-api.conf and restart the service - :: rpc_backend = glance.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu notification_driver = messaging rabbit_notification_exchange = glance Following is deprecated - :: notifier_strategy = rabbit Cinder to send notifications to the bus. Update the following in cinder.conf and restart the service - :: rpc_backend = glance.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu notification_driver = messaging # Time period must be hour, day, month or year volume_usage_audit_period=hour control_exchange=cinder Following is deprecated - :: notification_driver=cinder.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier cinder_volume_usage_audit_period=hour You may also need to setup the following cron job to generate usage notifications for volumes existing during the audit period. :: 5 * * * * /usr/bin/cinder-volume-usage-audit >/dev/null 2>&1
deleted_lines: Glance to send notifications to the bus by changing ``notifier_strategy`` to ``rabbit`` or ``qpid`` in ``glance-api.conf`` and restarting the service. Cinder to send notifications to the bus by changing ``notification_driver`` to ``cinder.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier`` and ``control_exchange`` to ``cinder``, before restarting the service.

commit_message:
Use oslo db.sqlalchemy.session.EngineFacade.from_config

Rather than passing the CONF dict to EngineFacade, Keystone can
use the new from_config factory function.

Change-Id: I60f30254431b512988a0f1811b3c119207b91ad7

commit_message:
Fix incorrect tempest config groups

This commit fixes a couple of tempest config options that were being
iniset to the wrong config group. This wasn't caught in the gate
because the default behaviors matched.

Change-Id: I273db85ba310faa1ba7662a42f951a1ee97b431b

commit_message:
Drop muranocommon dependency

Now, when Murano uses oslo-messaging there is not much left in murano-common
library. The only module we're using now is token_sanitizer. In order to reduce
maintenance complexity it would be much easier for us to just move
token_sanitizer to murano-api and deprecate murano-common.

Change-Id: I12bb3f7f783715ba0cd7460bbbf49ed84d9ccdb2
Partly-Implements: blueprint repository-reorganization

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import unittest2 as unittest from muranoapi.common import token_sanitizer class TokenSanitizerTests(unittest.TestCase): sanitizer = token_sanitizer.TokenSanitizer() def test_dict_with_one_value(self): source = {'token': 'value'} value = self.sanitizer.sanitize(source) self.assertEqual(value['token'], self.sanitizer.message) def test_dict_with_few_value(self): source = {'token': 'value', 'pass': 'value'} value = self.sanitizer.sanitize(source) self.assertEqual(value['token'], self.sanitizer.message) self.assertEqual(value['pass'], self.sanitizer.message) def test_dict_with_nested_dict(self): source = {'obj': {'pass': 'value'}} value = self.sanitizer.sanitize(source) self.assertEqual(value['obj']['pass'], self.sanitizer.message) def test_dict_with_nested_list(self): source = {'obj': [{'pass': 'value'}]} value = self.sanitizer.sanitize(source) self.assertEqual(value['obj'][0]['pass'], self.sanitizer.message) def test_leave_out_other_values(self): source = {'obj': ['value']} value = self.sanitizer.sanitize(source) self.assertEqual(value['obj'][0], 'value')

commit_message:
Don't allow reboot when instance in rebooting_hard

It shouldn't allow reboot a instance while the instance in
rebooting_hard task state.
If the instance is in rebooting_hard, solf reboot action is
meaningless.

Change-Id: I43147104a7473eaaf1b86f84386bb28b7e3574c3
Closes-bug: #1288926

commit_message:
Check if nfs/glusterfs export is already mounted

_mount_nfs() do not check if the nfs_share is already mounted on
the same mnt path and pollutes logs with warnings about
'mount.nfs: xxx busy or already mounted'.

The patch will add the method is_mounted to libvirt/utils.py and
use the findmnt tool to find if the same network share on the same target
mount point is already mounted.
If 'findmnt' is not available for any reason (part of utils-linux),
the check will always return False.

Closes-Bug: #1280306
Change-Id: I1d7384ba2f1f1bb82bfbae96cca2772266d2583e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/75029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _is_mounted(self, mount_path, nfs_share): """Check if nfs_share already mounted on target mount_path.""" try: check_cmd = ['findmnt', '--source', nfs_share, '--target', mount_path] utils.execute(*check_cmd) except Exception: pass return False if not self._is_mounted(mount_path, nfs_export): self._mount_nfs(mount_path, nfs_export, options, ensure=True)

commit_message:
Print a useful message for unknown server errors

If a server error is returned that has an unknown code, novaclient will
end up printing something similar to:

ClientException: <attribute 'message' of 'exceptions.BaseException' objects>

Setting a message for ClientException will ensure that something more
useful than that is printed.

Change-Id: I43a2a33017f9a5c1b79d7fd8af4153e91d296f7b
Closes-bug: 1295293
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/76/81876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: message = 'Unknown Error'

subject: Show Exception Name in Shell Output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-18 21:23:19.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/0b1a29e7b0f749276cdb8827aa38530cc2be61c9', 'message': 'Show Exception Name in Shell Output

Currently, when the CLI encounters an exception, only the exception
message is shown.  However, the name of the exception can be quite
informative as well.

For instance, an error message might read "Cannot do xyz", which
simply indicates the operation was unsucessful.  However, the attached
exception name (HTTPNotImplemented, for instance) indicates the
*reason* that the call was unsuccessful.

Change-Id: I0298477bd9d40d98c95bb797c68c47dbc952b345
'}]
commit_message:
Show Exception Name in Shell Output

Currently, when the CLI encounters an exception, only the exception
message is shown.  However, the name of the exception can be quite
informative as well.

For instance, an error message might read "Cannot do xyz", which
simply indicates the operation was unsucessful.  However, the attached
exception name (HTTPNotImplemented, for instance) indicates the
*reason* that the call was unsuccessful.

Change-Id: I0298477bd9d40d98c95bb797c68c47dbc952b345
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/70/81370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: details = {'name': strutils.safe_encode(e.__class__.__name__), 'msg': strutils.safe_encode(six.text_type(e))} print("ERROR (%(name)s): %(msg)s" % details,

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary stubbing in test_services

Stubs are already set in the setUp method. self.controller also does
not need to be recreated after updating the extensions list.

Change-Id: I372842bba3e4286da922e7d814137cefe4583bf5

commit_message:
Make sure the artifact name has no white spaces

we use this as the image name we pass down to the build_app and
we create directories etc.. which can't have spaces.

Change-Id: Ib45fbe6d4a650c3ab26e8078686fe71f4ba575f3

commit_message:
VMware: ensure that the task completed for resize operation

In the event of a VM resize, the code did not wait for the task
to complete. This may lead to a race condition.

Change-Id: I0ce28e9d83da2f0e5741ae99bfba4b0f1d20c699
Closes-bug: #1270573
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/67703/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.wait_for_task = False if resize_instance: def fake_wait_for_task(*args, **kwargs): self.wait_for_task = True self.stubs.Set(self.conn._session, "_wait_for_task", fake_wait_for_task) if resize_instance: self.assertTrue(self.wait_for_task) else: self.assertFalse(self.wait_for_task)

commit_message:
Add tests for filtering volumes

Add tests for filtering of volumes based on metadata, and also
some tests using more than one filters. Soon a patch is going
to arrive in Cinder which will enable filtering based on
volume types and size also. I'll add tests for the same as
soon as they get merged.

Change-Id: I4f6740700aefa9f433d75b56305478b0059654ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/88/63388/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2012-13 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.volume import base from tempest.openstack.common import log as logging from tempest.test import attr LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class VolumesListTestFilters(base.BaseVolumeTest): """ This test creates a number of 1G and 2G volumes. To run successfully, ensure that the backing file for the volume group that Cinder uses has space for at least 2 1G volumes and a 2G volume! If you are running a Devstack environment, ensure that the VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE is at least 5G in your localrc. """ _interface = 'json' def assertVolumesIn(self, fetched_list, expected_list): missing_vols = [v for v in expected_list if v not in fetched_list] if len(missing_vols) == 0: return def str_vol(vol): return "%s:%s" % (vol['id'], vol['display_name']) raw_msg = "Could not find volumes %s in expected list %s; fetched %s" self.fail(raw_msg % ([str_vol(v) for v in missing_vols], [str_vol(v) for v in expected_list], [str_vol(v) for v in fetched_list])) @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(VolumesListTestFilters, cls).setUpClass() cls.client = cls.volumes_client # Create 3 test volumes of different sizes, names, etc cls.vol_name_tuple = ('vol1', 'vol2', 'vol3') cls.vol_size_tuple = (1, 2, 1) cls.vol_meta_tuple = ({'tier': 'gold', 'speed': 'fast'}, {'tier': 'silver', 'speed': 'slow'}, {'speed': 'slow'}) cls.volume_list = [] cls.volume_id_list = [] for i in range(3): try: resp, volume = cls.client.\ create_volume(size=1, display_name=cls.vol_name_tuple[i], metadata=cls.vol_meta_tuple[i]) cls.client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') resp, volume = cls.client.get_volume(volume['id']) cls.volume_list.append(volume) cls.volume_id_list.append(volume['id']) except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(exc) if cls.volume_list: # We could not create all the volumes, though we were able # to create *some* of the volumes. This is typically # because the backing file size of the volume group is # too small. for volid in cls.volume_id_list: cls.client.delete_volume(volid) cls.client.wait_for_resource_deletion(volid) raise exc @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): # Delete the created volumes for volid in cls.volume_id_list: resp, _ = cls.client.delete_volume(volid) cls.client.wait_for_resource_deletion(volid) super(VolumesListTestFilters, cls).tearDownClass() def _list_by_param_value_and_assert(self, params, with_detail=False): """ Perform list or list_details action with given params and validates result. """ if with_detail: resp, fetched_vol_list = \ self.client.list_volumes_with_detail(params=params) else: resp, fetched_vol_list = self.client.list_volumes(params=params) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # Validating params of fetched volumes for volume in fetched_vol_list: for key in params: msg = "Failed to list volumes %s by %s" % \ ('details' if with_detail else '', key) if key == 'metadata': self.assertDictContainsSubset(params[key], volume[key], msg) elif key == 'size': self.assertEqual(params[key], int(volume[key]), msg) else: self.assertEqual(params[key], volume[key], msg) @attr(type='gate') def test_volume_filter_by_metadata(self): # Test filtering of volumes by metadata params = {'metadata': {'speed': 'slow'}} self._list_by_param_value_and_assert(params) @attr(type='gate') def test_volume_filter_with_detail_by_metadata(self): # Test filtering of volumes by metadata detail params = {'metadata': {'speed': 'slow'}} self._list_by_param_value_and_assert(params, with_detail=True) @attr(type='gate') def test_volume_filter_by_metadata_and_status(self): # Test filtering of volumes by metadata and status params = {'metadata': {'speed': 'slow'}, 'status': 'available'} self._list_by_param_value_and_assert(params) @attr(type='gate') def test_volume_filter_with_detail_by_metadata_and_status(self): # Test filtering of volumes by metadata and status detail params = {'metadata': {'speed': 'slow'}, 'status': 'available'} self._list_by_param_value_and_assert(params, with_detail=True) # TODO(rushiagr): Add tests for filtering based on size and volume type # once the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61549 arrives class VolumesListTestFiltersXML(VolumesListTestFilters): _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
Keep py3.X compatibility for urllib/urllib2

Use six.moves.urllib instead of urllib and
six.moves.urllib.request instead of urllib2.

Partial-Bug: #1280105

Change-Id: I23ba1c7ac3fd1799939faa5e4e9f7719d7259871

commit_message:
Adds debug.log_ip_ns() access to all Neutron nodes

Currently debug modes assumes that Tempest node is the same as the All-in-One
Openstack cloud under test. This patch removes this assumption and logs ip and
namespace data (nics, routing tables, and iptables) from all nodes in the
Neutron agent-list.
This patch also removes the usage of "sudo" in the commands module and replaces
it with the Openstack project-wide "rootwrap" solution, using the permissions
defined for Neutron.

Change-Id: I8e0af74aee116d9316077545fde8754869c3a1ab

commit_message:
Improve exception handling in test_security_groups_basic_ops

Move try/except block to focus on the actual testing code instead of
encompassing the entire scenario code

Change-Id: I76ad34b128985b26dbdc0ef74ad7436a299afb96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/77883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._verify_network_details(tenant) try: self._verify_mac_addr(tenant) except Exception: debug.log_ip_ns() self._log_console_output_from_all_tenants() raise self._log_console_output_from_all_tenants() def _log_console_output_from_all_tenants(self): nested_server_list = (t.servers for t in self.tenants.values()) flat_server_list = (server for sublist in nested_server_list for server in sublist) self._log_console_output(servers=flat_server_list) # deploy new tenant self._deploy_tenant(self.alt_tenant) # cross tenant check source_tenant = self.primary_tenant dest_tenant = self.alt_tenant self._test_cross_tenant_block(source_tenant, dest_tenant) self._test_cross_tenant_allow(source_tenant, dest_tenant) self._create_tenant_servers(self.primary_tenant, num=1) # in-tenant check self._test_in_tenant_block(self.primary_tenant) self._test_in_tenant_allow(self.primary_tenant)
deleted_lines: self._verify_network_details(self.primary_tenant) self._verify_mac_addr(self.primary_tenant) try: # deploy new tenant self._deploy_tenant(self.alt_tenant) self._verify_network_details(self.alt_tenant) self._verify_mac_addr(self.alt_tenant) # cross tenant check source_tenant = self.primary_tenant dest_tenant = self.alt_tenant self._test_cross_tenant_block(source_tenant, dest_tenant) self._test_cross_tenant_allow(source_tenant, dest_tenant) except Exception: for tenant in self.tenants.values(): self._log_console_output(servers=tenant.servers) raise try: self._create_tenant_servers(self.primary_tenant, num=1) # in-tenant check self._test_in_tenant_block(self.primary_tenant) self._test_in_tenant_allow(self.primary_tenant) except Exception: for tenant in self.tenants.values(): self._log_console_output(servers=tenant.servers) raise

commit_message:
Nova V3 APIs for Domain Quota Management

V3 APIs in Nova for using Domain Quota Driver to manage the quotas at domain, project and user level.
These APIs will enable Nova to enforce domain quotas. These APIs are implemented using new extension
os-domain-quota-sets.

This depends on Nova V2 APIs which is under review at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/75967/

Author: Vinod Kumar Boppanna <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>
Depends On: blueprint domain-quota-driver-api
Implements: blueprint domain-quota-driver-v3-api

Change-Id: I169526bb975899eb3d8ed25baf2aebd6b63a779d

of key_pairs in compute module.

commit_message:
Nova Commands for Domain Quota Management

Nova Commands for using Domain Quota Driver to manage the quotas at domain,
project and user level.

This depends on Nova V2 APIs which is under review at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/75967/

Depends On: blueprint domain-quota-driver-api
Implements: blueprint domain-quota-manage-commands

Change-Id: Ie0bfa28a7186a9a84425353f7550b6a5342777b5

subject: Added $LOCALRC_APPEND to devstack-vm-gate.sh.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-14 13:35:44.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/9aaa89aa97f5ca02dc1cf7ef19521b6915f6ca90', 'message': 'Added $LOCALRC_APPEND to devstack-vm-gate.sh.

The string value of this variable will be appended to the final
localrc file produced by the script. This can be used by the caller to
insert lines into localrc, for example:

export LOCALRC_APPEND="BOOT_TIMEOUT=120
ACTIVE_TIMEOUT=120"

If the variable is not set then it has no effect.

This provides an alternative for KEEP_LOCALRC for cases then the

Change-Id: Ibdc13490720f69b3a12cbf18dea176d640ec2c33
Closes-Bug: #1292527
'}]
commit_message:
Added $LOCALRC_APPEND to devstack-vm-gate.sh.

The string value of this variable will be appended to the final
localrc file produced by the script. This can be used by the caller to
insert lines into localrc, for example:

export LOCALRC_APPEND="BOOT_TIMEOUT=120
ACTIVE_TIMEOUT=120"

If the variable is not set then it has no effect.

This provides an alternative for KEEP_LOCALRC for cases then the
localrc values will be supplied by this script's caller.

Change-Id: Ibdc13490720f69b3a12cbf18dea176d640ec2c33
Closes-Bug: #1292527
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/66/80566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$LOCALRC_APPEND" ]; then # Append extra lines to localrc echo "$LOCALRC_APPEND" >>localrc fi

commit_message:
Raise HTTPInternalServerError when boot_from_volume with cinder down

This patch changes exception type.
Boot_from_volume api raises BlockDeviceMappingIsInvalid exception
when cinder-api is down.
Also it returns response code 400.
It is not exact. Because request is valid.
Exception was changed to raise HTTPInternalServerError and
return a 500 error.

Closes-Bug: #1239952

Change-Id: I592bcc16926826f346486785f5fdff6704891813

added_lines: from cinderclient import exceptions as cinder_exception def test_validate_bdm_with_down_of_volume_service(self): def fake_get(self, context, res_id): raise cinder_exception.ConnectionError() instance_type = {'swap': 1, 'ephemeral_gb': 1} all_mappings = [{'id': 1, 'no_device': None, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'snapshot_id': None, 'volume_id': self.volume_id, 'device_name': 'vda', 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': False}] self.stubs.Set(cinder.API, 'get', fake_get) self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.ConnectionError, self.compute_api._validate_bdm, self.context, self.instance, instance_type, all_mappings)

commit_message:
Validation for Outputs template section

Previously we get error only when try to show outputs.
This patch add avaliability for validation outputs in case
when we use built in functions in it.

Change-Id: Ia9353195d09d165b726502c8c7aced7df6d69b5b
Closes-bug: #1273490
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/58/70358/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine.template import _resolve self.check_resource_attribute() def check_resource_attribute(self): def match_get_attr(key, value): return (key in ['get_attr', 'Fn::GetAtt'] and isinstance(value, list) and len(value) == 2 and None not in value and value[0] in self.resources) def handle_get_attr(args): resource, att = args r = self.resources[resource] if att in r.attributes: return None raise exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute(resource=resource, key=att) for key in self.outputs: value = self.outputs[key].get('Value', '') _resolve(match_get_attr, handle_get_attr, value)

commit_message:
Support get_host_uptime in docker driver

The host uptime method is quite simple to support
and is low-hanging-fruit toward getting Tempest passing
and increasing the scope of API compatibility for the
Docker driver.

This change pulls get_host_uptime into a new hostutils
module using this method from both libvirt and docker.

Change-Id: I2e64af19c9849562390a232b3406eef235a369b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/76373/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_host_uptime(self, host): """Returns the result of calling "uptime".""" #NOTE(dprince): host seems to be ignored for this call and in # other compute drivers as well. Perhaps we should remove it? out, err = utils.execute('env', 'LANG=C', 'uptime') return out

commit_message:
Skip server rescue tests if cinder is not available

The server rescue tests depend on volumes but are
not skipped if Cinder is known not to be available.

If CONF.service_available.cinder is False, we will
now skip server rescue tests.

Change-Id: Ieb1c910e06db3438907f28eb3c5e9e73e122e068
Closes-Bug: #1289417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/95/78995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import configCONF = config.CONF if not CONF.service_available.cinder: skip_msg = ("%s skipped as Cinder is not available" % cls.__name__) raise cls.skipException(skip_msg)

commit_message:
Fix non-integrity issue when syncing from oslo-incubator

This commit adds missing modules in openstack-common.conf, removes
ones not in directory openstack/common, and add missing file __init__.py
for module config.

Note: this is detected by commit in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76901/.
Once the commit is merged, update.py will check similar issues automatically
when syncing code from oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I6738b014b5d4ba7546c3e9acec4a939c28dbc34f

commit_message:
Adding NoopMounter for LVM backed images.

LVM backed images are already available as block devices
and thus do not need to be mounted to nbd or loopback
devices. So, that step is skipped and the LVM device is
mounted directly to the instance's rootfs directory.

Change-Id: I8913fbe82b7a9efab92d3f2eb725c2e55ffa87df
Closes-bug: 1287754

commit_message:
Enable delete_port to tolerate deadlocks

When running the scale tests there were cases when delete_port would
throw a DBDeadlock exception, resulting in ports not being deleted.
This is a port from Nova for the deadlock issue

(cherry picked from commit e53e22271ed7e7a9b919d817a8eb50a1ecce16f8
                       and 5e6facb73a805fb652af744779378d7bb784e495
                       and 1e43511dde8c8a2d4e37b87cc8f1fe70e7471b16)
Conflicts:
    neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py
    neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py

Change-Id: I486a40059cb2675471bc84b3a23302ca3a0ab419
Closes-bug: #1288379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/78643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsimport timefrom neutron.openstack.common.db import exception as db_excdef _retry_on_deadlock(f=None, max_tries=5): """Decorator to retry a DB API call if Deadlock was received. :param max_tries: Configures the max attempts logic. (default=5) """ if f is None: return functools.partial(_retry_on_deadlock, max_tries=max_tries) @functools.wraps(f) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): attempts = 0 while attempts < max_tries: attempts += 1 try: return f(*args, **kwargs) except db_exc.DBDeadlock: LOG.warn(_("Deadlock detected when running " "'%(func_name)s': Retrying..."), dict(func_name=f.__name__)) # Retry! time.sleep(0.5) continue raise db_exc.DBError(_("Deadlock occured on '%(func_name)s'. After " "%(attempts)d attempts, not able to fix it.") % {'func_name': f.__name__, 'attempts': attempts}) return wrapped @_retry_on_deadlock

subject: Raise an exception if starting cells but cells is not enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-14 18:09:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bf71f8eb36f6797b61474cd6e11120cae27d5f1a', 'message': "Don't sync cells data if cells is disabled

If the cells service is running but disabled, it still syncs the
database every 60 seconds by default. This patch skips the sync if
cells is disabled (the default configuration) and logs an info
level message on init if that's the case.

An alternative solution was checking CONF.cells.enable in the sync_after
decorator and the _time_to_sync methods, but those don't handle all of
the force cases.

Adds tests for both types of state managers.

Closes-Bug: 1237154

Change-Id: I30714b0037a907234cf5d862c3b07316c3c5428a

commit_message:
Raise an exception if starting cells but cells is not enabled

It doesn't make much sense to run the cells service if it's not enabled
in the config file, so raise an exception on init in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1237154

Change-Id: I30714b0037a907234cf5d862c3b07316c3c5428a

commit_message:
Allow discovery of available API versions thru the client

Note that this only implements this functionality for programmatic use.
CLI exposure will be covered in a separate blueprint and patch.

Implements bp discover-available-api-versions

Change-Id: I17068f432b88ebf3cd8a13e10b509ddd548475f9

added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Rackspace Hosting # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import logging from glanceclient.common import http from glanceclient import exc LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class VersionClient(http.HTTPClient): def __init__(self, endpoint): super(VersionClient, self).__init__(endpoint) def getVersions(self): headers = { 'Accept': 'application/json' } method = 'GET' url = '' self.log_curl_request(method, url, kwargs={'headers': headers}) conn = self.get_connection() conn.request(method, url, headers=headers) resp = conn.getresponse() if resp.status == 300: try: body_iter = http.ResponseBodyIterator(resp) body = ''.join([chunk for chunk in body_iter]) body = json.loads(body) except ValueError: LOG.error('Could not decode response body as JSON') body = None else: raise exc.from_response(resp) return body

commit_message:
Remove last XML namespace definitions from V3 API plugins

Removes the remaining XML namespace definitions from the
V3 API. Most of these all originally came from the bp v3-admin-actions
split and were not removed in the original patchset to avoid
another merge conflict for the admin actions series of patches.

Partially implements blueprint remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: Ic319ddd0bcf380711f5393396e152ffed708e8fd

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import six from openstack.common.gettextutils import _ from openstack.common import log from openstack.common import strutils LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class Error(Exception): message_format = None def __init__(self, message=None, **kwargs): try: message = self._build_message(message, **kwargs) except KeyError: LOG.warning(_('missing exception kwargs (programmer error)')) message = self.message_format super(Error, self).__init__(message) def _build_message(self, message, **kwargs): """Builds and returns an exception message. :raises: KeyError given insufficient kwargs """ if not message: try: message = self.message_format % kwargs except UnicodeDecodeError: try: kwargs = dict([(k, strutils.safe_decode(v)) for k, v in six.iteritems(kwargs)]) except UnicodeDecodeError: # NOTE(jamielennox): This is the complete failure case # at least by showing the template we have some idea # of where the error is coming from message = self.message_format else: message = self.message_format % kwargs return message class LockTimeout(Error): message_format = _('Lock Timeout occurred for key, %(target)s') class ConfigurationValidationError(Error): message_format = _('Configuration Validation Error: %(msg)s') class RegionNotConfigured(Error): message_format = _('Cache Region %(region_name)s is not configured.') class RegionAlreadyConfigured(Error): message_format = _('Cache Region %(region_name)s is already configured.')

commit_message:
Lowercase all image names for Docker driver

Docker repository names must be lowercase. When
an image is requested or a snapshot is created,
the requested name should be lowercased such that
it may be given a valid name in the Docker registry.

Adds tests for snapshots and get_image_name.

Change-Id: I97b281d30454e33ba32e428901bb5da58400308f
Closes-bug: 1284761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/76382/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add CPU information to the stats

It is good to correlate average response time with CPU load.
This patch adds cpu information to stats DB.
It adds a new requirement: psutil

Change-Id: I5339ea7af2d08e6ce7f5036320864749e11efd76
Partly-Implements: blueprint api-request-stats

commit_message:
Fix bug:range() is not same in py3.x and py2.x

in python3.x, there is no method named xrange(),
it has replaced by range(),which is equal to xrange() in python2.x.
so we must fix this issue.we use six module to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I9cee3f0df2d8abbf6f66d7c5a3a0fed98df622e8
Closes-Bug: #1268439
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/82/67382/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import xrange

subject: Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-15 01:43:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/129d023dc92424ac49dcb20cdb7cfe6da3527355', 'message': 'Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__

If DevStack is configured for the Cisco Nexus plugin, the following
error is observed:

Exception RuntimeError: 'maximum recursion depth exceeded' in <bound
method ConnectionContext.__del__ of
<neutron.openstack.common.rpc.amqp.ConnectionContext object at
0x403a3d0>> ignored

An investigation shows that this failure is triggered when the Neutron
controller checks to see if the plugin (Cisco Nexus in this case)
supports a native pagination attribute. The maximum recursion begins
when the plugin raises this exception:

             raise AttributeError(
                 _("'%(model)s' object has no attribute '%(name)s'") %
                {'model': self._model, 'name': name})

in the PluginV2.__getattr__ method in
neutron/plugins/cisco/network_plugin.py. The problem here is that the
self._model object is being mod'd as a string. (We should be passing
a string object, rather than trying to convert an object to a string
in the unicode message.) Because the neutron server
has "lazy gettext" (deferred interpretation of unicode objects) enabled
by default, the __mod__ method of the lazy gettext's Message object
will attempt to do the %s mod'ing of the self._model object by
doing recursive calls to deepcopy (a call to deepcopy for all objects
associated with self._model).

Here is a snippet of traceback (using instrumented debug code):

  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/api/v2/base.py", line 67, in __init__
    self._native_pagination = self._is_native_pagination_supported()
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/api/v2/base.py", line 119,
in _is_native_pagination_supported
    return getattr(self._plugin, native_pagination_attr_name, False)
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/plugins/cisco/network_plugin.py",
line 114, in __getattr__
    {\'model\': self._model, \'name\': name})
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/openstack/common/gettextutils.py",
line 196, in __mod__
    params = self._sanitize_mod_params(other)
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/openstack/common/gettextutils.py",
line 216, in _sanitize_mod_params
    params = self._trim_dictionary_parameters(other)
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/openstack/common/gettextutils.py",
line 249, in _trim_dictionary_parameters
    params[key] = self._copy_param(src[key])
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/openstack/common/gettextutils.py",
line 259, in _copy_param
    return six.text_type(param)
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py",
line 163, in __del__
    tb = traceback.format_list(traceback.extract_stack())

What's not shown in the traceback are the (at least 150) nested calls to
deepcopy.

The fix for this problem is fairly obvious: Pass a simple string
to the AttributeError exception mod format, rather than an object.

However, creating a unit test case for this failure, esp. one that
fails without the fix and passes with the fix, was a bit of work.
I was unable to reproduce the maximum recursion error in the tox unit
test environment that I was seeing in the live DevStack environment.
I chalk this up to differences between the tox unit test environment
and the full neutron server running in a DevStack environment. For
example, the neutron server has several RPC connection contexts, and
the deepcopy recursion that I was seeing while PDB stepping through
this failure included deepcopies of RPC objects. In the end, I figured
it would be a sufficient unit test to make sure that we weren't doing
any recursive calls to deepcopy when processing the unicode object
for the AttributeError being raised when lazy gettext mode is enabled.

Change-Id: I0a07a0ab417add68e44cb1bca722cb0b4a71205b
Closes-Bug: #1286565
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-18 14:10:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/cisco/test_network_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/cisco/network_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c36ddaf930ba309be3c127dc1836f28a8ab97c5d', 'message': 'Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__

If DevStack is configured for the Cisco Nexus plugin, the following
error is observed:

Exception RuntimeError: 'maximum recursion depth exceeded' in <bound
method ConnectionContext.__del__ of
<neutron.openstack.common.rpc.amqp.ConnectionContext object at
0x403a3d0>> ignored

The root cause of the problem is that the Cisco Nexus plugin's
PluginV2.__gettattr__ method, a model object is being passed
as a value for a unicode %s format mod. Because the neutron server
has "lazy gettext" (deferred interpretation of unicode objects) enabled,
this causes many layers of recursive calls to deepcopy.

The fix is to pass a string object for the unicode %s mod field.

Change-Id: I0a07a0ab417add68e44cb1bca722cb0b4a71205b
Closes-Bug: #1286565
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-18 14:10:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3f00c2069e9b592fdcf6b8d8e5e148add5e7a905', 'message': 'Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__

If DevStack is configured for the Cisco Nexus plugin, the following
error is observed:

Exception RuntimeError: 'maximum recursion depth exceeded' in <bound
method ConnectionContext.__del__ of
<neutron.openstack.common.rpc.amqp.ConnectionContext object at
0x403a3d0>> ignored

The root cause of the problem is that the Cisco Nexus plugin's
PluginV2.__gettattr__ method, a model object is being passed
as a value for a unicode %s format mod. Because the neutron server
has "lazy gettext" (deferred interpretation of unicode objects) enabled,
this causes many layers of recursive calls to deepcopy.

The fix is to pass a string object for the unicode %s mod field.

Change-Id: I0a07a0ab417add68e44cb1bca722cb0b4a71205b
Closes-Bug: #1286565
'}]
commit_message:
Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__

If DevStack is configured for the Cisco Nexus plugin, the following
error is observed:

Exception RuntimeError: 'maximum recursion depth exceeded' in <bound
method ConnectionContext.__del__ of
<neutron.openstack.common.rpc.amqp.ConnectionContext object at
0x403a3d0>> ignored

The root cause of the problem is that the Cisco Nexus plugin's
PluginV2.__gettattr__ method, a model object is being passed
as a value for a unicode %s format mod. Because the neutron server
has "lazy gettext" (deferred interpretation of unicode objects) enabled,
this causes many layers of recursive calls to deepcopy.

The fix is to pass a string object for the unicode %s mod field.

Change-Id: I0a07a0ab417add68e44cb1bca722cb0b4a71205b
Closes-Bug: #1286565

commit_message:
Add helper method for injecting data in an image

Add a _inject_data method whish helps to injecting data
in a disk image file system.
Update the _create_image method to use this helper

Change-Id: Ia005eee0a34d77bbf3eb33f7fef231dcf1eabe2c
Related-Bug: #1271528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/77593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _inject_data(self, instance, network_info, admin_pass, files, suffix): """Injects data in an disk image At this point we are not using configdrive, this private method helps for injecting data in a disk image. Different kinds of items could be injected to the file system: (key, password, metadata, network, files) Keyword arguments: instance -- a dict that refer instance specifications network_info -- a dict that refer network speficications admin_pass -- a string used to set an admin password files -- a list of files needs to be injected suffix -- a string used as a image name suffix """ # Handles the partition need to be used. target_partition = None if not instance['kernel_id']: target_partition = CONF.libvirt.inject_partition if target_partition == 0: target_partition = None if CONF.libvirt.virt_type == 'lxc': target_partition = None # Handles the key injection. if CONF.libvirt.inject_key and instance.get('key_data'): key = str(instance['key_data']) else: key = None # Handles the admin password injection. if not CONF.libvirt.inject_password: admin_pass = None # Handles the network injection. net = netutils.get_injected_network_template(network_info) # Handles the metadata injection metadata = instance.get('metadata') image_type = CONF.libvirt.images_type if any((key, net, metadata, admin_pass, files)): injection_path = self.image_backend.image( instance, 'disk' + suffix, image_type).path img_id = instance['image_ref'] try: disk.inject_data(injection_path, key, net, metadata, admin_pass, files, partition=target_partition, use_cow=CONF.use_cow_images, mandatory=('files',)) except Exception as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_('Error injecting data into image ' '%(img_id)s (%(e)s)'), {'img_id': img_id, 'e': e}, instance=instance) self._inject_data( instance, network_info, admin_pass, files, suffix)
deleted_lines: target_partition = None if not instance['kernel_id']: target_partition = CONF.libvirt.inject_partition if target_partition == 0: target_partition = None if CONF.libvirt.virt_type == 'lxc': target_partition = None if CONF.libvirt.inject_key and instance['key_data']: key = str(instance['key_data']) else: key = None net = netutils.get_injected_network_template(network_info) metadata = instance.get('metadata') if not CONF.libvirt.inject_password: admin_pass = None if any((key, net, metadata, admin_pass, files)): # If we're not using config_drive, inject into root fs injection_path = image('disk').path img_id = instance['image_ref'] for inj, val in [('key', key), ('net', net), ('metadata', metadata), ('admin_pass', admin_pass), ('files', files)]: if val: LOG.info(_('Injecting %(inj)s into image ' '%(img_id)s'), {'inj': inj, 'img_id': img_id}, instance=instance) try: disk.inject_data(injection_path, key, net, metadata, admin_pass, files, partition=target_partition, use_cow=CONF.use_cow_images, mandatory=('files',)) except Exception as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_('Error injecting data into image ' '%(img_id)s (%(e)s)'), {'img_id': img_id, 'e': e}, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Adjust logging levels and usage to follow standards

A few of our logging levels and messages should be
updated to better reflect the oslo logging standards
created at https://wiki.openstack.org/LoggingStandards
so update some of them to not report error when its really
warning level and not report warning when debug is better.

Change-Id: I8abdb1bcfa2893c6b97eda7e85ac779e456966b8

commit_message:
Documentation for deploying DevStack /w Ironic

Adds a section to the developer quickstart doc explaining
how to deploy Ironic as part of devstack.

Change-Id: I26a6f8faa882bfaa94dd6eb26e6bef197f12b25c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/23/81123/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploying Ironic with DevStack ================================ DevStack may be configured to deploy Ironic, setup Nova to use the Ironic driver and provide hardware resources (network, baremetal compute nodes) using a combination of OpenVSwitch and libvirt. It is highly recommended DevStack be deployed in an expendable virtual machine and not on your personal work station. .. seealso:: https://devstack.org Prepare the system (Ubuntu 12.04):: sudo apt-get install python-software-properties git sudo add-apt-repository cloud-archive:havana sudo apt-get update Clone DevStack:: cd ~ git clone https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack.git devstack Create devstack/localrc with minimal settings required to enable Ironic:: cd devstack cat >localrc <<END # Enable Ironic API and Ironic Conductor enable_service ironic enable_service ir-api enable_service ir-cond # Enable Neutron which is required by Ironic and disable nova-network. disable_service n-net enable_service q-svc enable_service q-agt enable_service q-dhcp enable_service q-l3 enable_service q-meta enable_service neutron BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK=True BM_DEPLOY_FLAVOR='-a amd64 ubuntu deploy-ironic' IRONIC_VM_COUNT=3 IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=512 IRONIC_VM_SPECS_DISK=10 IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS=True IRONIC_VM_SSH_PORT=22 LOGFILE=$HOME/devstack.log VIRT_DRIVER=ironic # These may need to be tweaked for your environment. NETWORK_GATEWAY=10.1.0.1 FIXED_RANGE=10.1.0.0/24 FIXED_NETWORK_SIZE=256 END Run stack.sh:: ./stack.sh Source credentials, create a key, spawn an instance:: source ~/devstack/openrc # query the image id of the default cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec image nova image-list image=21eef080-e562-4586-ba80-3fc57de25fd2 # create keypair ssh-keygen nova keypair-add default --pub-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub # spawn instance nova boot --flavor baremetal --image $image --key-name default ironic-test Ironic conductor will be interfacing with libvirt via SSH to power on a virtual machine, which will PXE + TFTP boot from the conductor node and progress through the Ironic provisioning workflow. After Nova has launched the instance, you should see one active libvirt domain that should be addressable at the fixed IP assigned to the instance:: sudo virsh list --all Id Name State ---------------------------------------------------- 2 baremetalbrbm_2 running - baremetalbrbm_0 shut off - baremetalbrbm_1 shut off ssh cirros@10.1.0.4 $ ================================

commit_message:
Fix duplicate name of NVP LBaaS objs not allowed on vShield Edge

Duplicate name of LBaaS objs such as pool/vip/app_profile is not
allowed on vShield Edge, so here a name convention is needed to ensure
name uniqueness on the edge side.
Closes-Bug: #1257225

Change-Id: I953610d0389a78aa01f378c2ff4931d8c74413ea

commit_message:
Add enable_security_group option

Using noop driver to disable security group is confusing.
In this commit, we introduce enable_security_group in server side.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Implements bp: security-group-config-cleanup
Related-Bug: 1112912
Change-Id: Ice44a4e2a519c64e613eeb24372de46726473339

commit_message:
Avoid creating FixedIntervalLoopingCall in agent UT

Set polling_interval to 0 to avoid creating LoopingCall
in loadbalancer agent tests, dhcp agent tests, linuxbridge agent tests

commit_message:
NSX: lower the severity of messages about VIF's on external networks

Set the message to INFO as there is no error to recover from or
something bad about to happen. The only place where this occurs
is during the setup of probe interfaces in DevStack.

Change-Id: I2310af00676e508646783ce769a8830ab0b9308f

commit_message:
Fix vm-slug/prepare update-guestfs-applicance not found

The package update-guestfs-applicance could not be found when executing
vm-slug/prepare in ubuntu saucy: libguestfs-tools is required
options -o Dpkg::Options::='--force-confold' --force-yes were added to
apt-get install in order to disable the yes/no screen prompt.

Closes-Bug: #1295692
Change-Id: I4c83d650509cc06f066d7183ac9be7e73de44283
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/03/82103/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get -y install -o Dpkg::Options::='--force-confold' --force-yes libguestfs-tools

subject: NEC plugin: Remove a colon from binding:profile key due to XML problem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-21 19:47:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nec/common/exceptions.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nec/test_portbindings.py', 'neutron/plugins/nec/nec_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e10f406a653f3037109e2d7f59bed65bd54300a8', 'message': 'NEC plugin: Remove a colon from binding:profile key due to XML problem

In XML specification, if a tag name contains a colon, a part before
a colon is interpreted as namespace. If key names in binding:profile
dict contains a colon, Neutron XML serializer sends them as-is.
A colon in key names should be used only if XML namespace are used.
NEC plugin uses a colon in key names and it leads to failures to XML
deserialization. To avoid this problem, this commit removes a colon
and prefix n key names in port binding:profile so that client XML
deserializer decodes XML response successfully.

Change-Id: Ie32a2417bbce03bfc6e8f7907c0b4090fbc9e7b6
Closes-Bug: #1294166
'}]
commit_message:
NEC plugin: Remove a colon from binding:profile key due to XML problem

In XML specification, if a tag name contains a colon, a part before
a colon is interpreted as namespace. If key names in binding:profile
dict contains a colon, Neutron XML serializer sends them as-is.
A colon in key names should be used only if XML namespace are used.
NEC plugin uses a colon in key names and it leads to failures to XML
deserialization. To avoid this problem, this commit removes a colon
and prefix n key names in port binding:profile so that client XML
deserializer decodes XML response successfully.

Change-Id: Ie32a2417bbce03bfc6e8f7907c0b4090fbc9e7b6
Closes-Bug: #1294166

commit_message:
Log received pool.status

This patch adds a log statement so we can figure out what status the
lbaas-agent is passing in. This way we can figure out what to prevent.

Change-Id: I1a0f809140127ccb9596d83c97add03a853991a3
Closes-bug: #1295491

commit_message:
Produce a useful error message for NoUniqueMatch

Most of the CLIs use a NoUniqueMatch, so produce a useful
error message if that happens.  Added some tests for
find_resource as well.

Change-Id: I85ba61d5f6d1be5bd336a1cc4b02501492905f33
Closes-Bug: #1293846

commit_message:
Better instance-not-found handling within IronicDriver

Improve the handling of failed spawns and multiple deletes within the
IronicDriver.

Change-Id: I284f4669ba14db7bb33b5a53512b6a3822ad170c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/25/80425/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_instance_and_node(icli, instance): """Get and validate a node's uuid out of a manager instance dict. The compute manager is meant to know the node uuid, so missing uuid a significant issue - it may mean we've been passed someone elses data. Check with the Ironic service that this node is still associated with this instance. This catches situations where Nova's instance dict contains stale data (eg, a delete on an instance that's already gone). """ try: return icli.node.get_by_instance_uuid(instance['uuid']) except ironic_exception.HTTPNotFound: raise exception.InstanceNotFound(instance_id=instance['uuid']) # The compute manager is meant to know the node uuid, so missing uuid # a significant issue - it may mean we've been passed someone elses data. node_uuid = instance.get('node') if not node_uuid: raise exception.NovaException(_("Ironic node uuid not supplied to " "driver for instance %r.") % instance['uuid']) # NOTE(deva): this may raise a NodeAlreadyAssociated exception # which we allow to propagate up to the scheduler, # so it retries on another node. try: node = validate_instance_and_node(icli, instance) node_uuid = node.uuid except exception.InstanceNotFound: LOG.debug(_("Destroy called on non-existing instance %r.") % instance['uuid']) # NOTE(deva): if nova.compute.ComputeManager._delete_instance() # is called on a non-existing instance, the only way # to delete it is to return from this method # without raising any exceptions. return except Exception as e: # if the node is already in a deprovisioned state, continue # This should be fixed in Ironic. XXX [insert bug here] if e.__name__ == 'InstanceDeployFailure': pass try: patch = [{'op': 'remove', 'path': '/instance_uuid'}] node = validate_instance_and_node(icli, instance) icli.node.set_power_state(node.uuid, 'off') node = validate_instance_and_node(icli, instance) icli.node.set_power_state(node.uuid, 'on')
deleted_lines: def _require_node(self, instance): """Get a node's uuid out of a manager instance dict. The compute manager is meant to know the node uuid, so missing uuid a significant issue - it may mean we've been passed someone elses data. """ node_uuid = instance.get('node') if not node_uuid: raise exception.NovaException( _("Ironic node uuid not supplied to driver for %r") % instance['uuid']) return node_uuid node_uuid = self._require_node(instance) # FIXME: this SHOULD function as a lock, so no other instance # can be associated to this node. BUT IT DOESN'T! node_uuid = self._require_node(instance) node = icli.node.get(node_uuid) patch = [{'op': 'remove', 'path': '/instance_uuid'}] try: node_uuid = self._require_node(instance) icli.node.set_power_state(node_uuid, 'off') node_uuid = self._require_node(instance) icli.node.set_power_state(node_uuid, 'on')

subject: Block X-Backend* in gatekeeper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-21 02:00:54.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/gatekeeper.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_gatekeeper.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c4a2313f4540c4512454788d4d4a3f330d5f65d3', 'message': 'Block X-Backend* in gatekeeper

By moving the blocking to gatekeeper from the proxy server, we gain
the ability to pass X-Backend headers in via InternalClient while
still keeping real clients from using them.

I wanted this functionality while working on storage policies; I had
an InternalClient and wanted to tell it to use a specific policy index
instead of what the container said, and that seemed like a good time
for an X-Backend header.

Change-Id: I4089e980d3cfca660365c7df799723b1f16ba277
'}]
commit_message:
Block X-Backend* in gatekeeper

By moving the blocking to gatekeeper from the proxy server, we gain
the ability to pass X-Backend headers in via InternalClient while
still keeping real clients from using them.

I wanted this functionality while working on storage policies; I had
an InternalClient and wanted to tell it to use a specific policy index
instead of what the container said, and that seemed like a good time
for an X-Backend header.

Change-Id: I4089e980d3cfca660365c7df799723b1f16ba277

commit_message:
Add wsgi_intercept to global_requirements

The Trove unit tests require the wsgi_intercept>0.6.1 python package
which doesn't exist in in the global requirements today.
Adding this package requirement to the global requirements.
The library was tested on: Python 2.6.9, Python 2.7.3, and
Python 3.2.3

Change-Id: I62c139c3754f5aefe718ad12e1d61bc054708f4c

commit_message:
Put X-Timestamp in object 404 responses

This way the container reconciler can tell (sometimes) that an object
was deleted at a certain time.

Change-Id: I3a56f2367585803b82f0b254946896c34746f9ca

commit_message:
Support disabling server pausing for compute API

This adds a togglable compute feature for pause/unpause.

The Docker driver does not currently support this feature.

Change-Id: I6f5f1f4624e34801aa52def7450e65716073fc65

commit_message:
is_revoked check all viable subtrees

An indentation error coupled with an early return lead to cases
where a subtree containing a pertinent revocation event was not
searched, and a revoked token would report as unrevoked.

Closes-bug: #1294292
Change-Id: If56ae64d8a30b461563ee8be002544117fb14215
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/35/81235/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Alternative names to be checked in token for every field in # revoke tree. 'domain_id': ['identity_domain_id', 'assignment_domain_id'], } # Contains current forest (collection of trees) to be checked. forest = [self.revoke_map] # We iterate over every layer of our revoke tree (except the last one). for name in _NAMES: # Here we will collect branches (subtrees) of every tree in current # forest that have to do with our token. # For every tree in current forest. for tree in forest: # If there is wildcard node on current level we take it. # Roles are very special since token have a list of them # and any one of them will suffice. # For other fields we try to get any branch that concur # with any alternative field in the token. # Since we use only tree.get in previous loop we can end up with # lots of None values in our bundle that represent branches that # would relate to our token but were not there. This call filters # them out. bundle = filter(None, bundle) # If we end up with no branches to follow means that the token is # definitelly not in the revoke tree and all further iterations # will be for nothing. if not bundle: # Note that else: branch will not happen after this. break # On the next iteration we walk through collected branches and # collect their subbranches. forest = bundle # The last (leaf) level is checked in a special way because we verify # issued_at field differently. else: for leaf in forest: issued_before = leaf.get('issued_before') # It might happen that leaf node lacks 'issued_before' key. if issued_before is not None: # But if it does, we throw away tokens that conform it. if issued_before > token_data['issued_at']: return True # If we made it out of the loop then no element in revokation tree # corresponds to our token and it is good. return False
deleted_lines: 'domain_id': ['identity_domain_id', 'assignment_domain_id']} subnode = [self.revoke_map] for name in _NAMES: for tree in subnode: bundle = filter(None, bundle) if not bundle: return False subnode = bundle else: for leaf in subnode: issued_before = leaf.get('issued_before') if issued_before is not None: if issued_before > token_data['issued_at']: return True

commit_message:
Add keystone exceptions wrapper for openstack clients

* Added decorator which wraps keystone exceptions
* Added unit tests with no auth_token and with heat client cached

Change-Id: If42efe5f6806b12e7aabfd943150917a0b8f7618
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/08/80308/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools import sys from keystoneclient import exceptions as keystone_exceptions def verify_client(field_name): """Decorator that ensures a client has a auth_token and returns directly a cached client if available, returns None if there is no auth_token. """ def wrap(func): @functools.wraps(func) def func_verify_client(self, *args, **kwargs): def _cache_client(self): attr_client = getattr(self, field_name) if attr_client: return attr_client def _verify_auth(self): client = None try: client = func(self, *args, **kwargs) except keystone_exceptions.AuthorizationFailure: LOG.error("%s connection failed, reason: %s" % (field_name, sys.exc_info()[1])) return client _cache_client(self) return _verify_auth(self) return func_verify_client return wrap print('test2') @verify_client('_heat') def heat(self):
deleted_lines: def heat(self): if self._heat: return self._heat if self.auth_token is None: LOG.error(_("Heat connection failed, no auth_token!")) return None

commit_message:
Fix help string for a glance option

The help for 'glance_api_servers' configuration option referred to
'nova'. This changes it to refer to 'ironic' instead.

commit_message:
Conductor de-registers on shutdown

Conductor service should de-register itself upon shutdown.
This will cause RPC requests to immediately stop routing to it
rather than there being an unnecessary period of malfunction
before the next heartbeat cycle.

A new unit test (test_stop_unregisters_conductor) is added to
validate the de-registration of the conductor. Test hostname
values are coalesced into a single variable for consistency.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I1feea2c0165cde36f2abb95c3fa3484c73dfd81c

commit_message:
Add service/endpoint discover to verify_tempest_config

This commit adds a check to verify_tempest_config for which services
are available. This is used to do 2 things:

1. Verify that the entries in the service_availble group are set correctly
2. Use for filtering which checks inside the script are valid to perform

Partially implements bp config-verification

Change-Id: Ib0e55f21b83d0746994e7e7e1f9666524e1bb3b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/04/72004/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_service_availability(os): services = [] avail_services = [] codename_match = { 'volume': 'cinder', 'network': 'neutron', 'images': 'glance', 'object_storage': 'swift', 'compute': 'nova', 'orchestration': 'heat', 'metering': 'ceilometer', 'telemetry': 'ceilometer', 'data_processing': 'savanna', 'baremetal': 'ironic', 'identity': 'keystone' } # Get catalog list for endpoints to use for validation __, endpoints = os.endpoints_client.list_endpoints() for endpoint in endpoints: __, service = os.service_client.get_service(endpoint['service_id']) services.append(service['type']) # Pull all catalog types from config file and compare against endpoint list for cfgname in dir(CONF._config): cfg = getattr(CONF, cfgname) catalog_type = getattr(cfg, 'catalog_type', None) if not catalog_type: continue else: if cfgname == 'identity': #Keystone is a required service for tempest continue if catalog_type not in services: if getattr(CONF.service_available, codename_match[cfgname]): print('Endpoint type %s not found either disable service ' '%s or fix the catalog_type in the config file' % ( catalog_type, codename_match[cfgname])) else: if not getattr(CONF.service_available, codename_match[cfgname]): print('Endpoint type %s is available, service %s should be' ' set as available in the config file.' % ( catalog_type, codename_match[cfgname])) else: avail_services.append(codename_match[cfgname]) return avail_services services = check_service_availability(os) if service == 'nova_v3' and 'nova' not in services: continue elif service not in services:
deleted_lines: def check_service_availability(service): if service == 'nova_v3': service = 'nova' return getattr(CONF.service_available, service) # TODO(mtreinish) make this a keystone endpoint check for available # services if not check_service_availability(service): print("%s is not available" % service)

commit_message:
Make H202 check honor pep8 #noqa comment

Several other checks allow for skipping lines with the standard pep8
 #noqa comment. This patch adds this for the H202 rule (don't use
assertRaises(Exception) as it may be too broad).

Change-Id: I134881298c0a42825764049667aa5b09652935ea
(cherry picked from commit e7d688c22901386dfcb7b20b1d1f1d474112f470)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/24/82224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def hacking_except_format_assert(logical_line, physical_line): Okay: self.assertRaises(Exception) # noqa Okay: self.assertRaises(Exception, foo) # noqa if pep8.noqa(physical_line): return

subject: Add noqa support for H201 (bare except)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-21 21:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/core.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/commit/7769d97b1f729364bf4a3907eef15f7e439b30f8', 'message': "Add noqa support for H201 (bare except)

This'll be nice to have in high-level exception handlers that really do want
to catch *everything*

For example, Swift has some error handling code that is intended to
prevent exceptions from ever getting back to the user.  Because we
don't know what exception classes a third-party lib might raise
(including ones that might not inherit from Exception), it is not
possible to enumerate all of the possible exceptions so a bare
except: is the only reasonable option.

Change-Id: I4b44185df6b43316446b37225741523c7c829a3f
(cherry picked from commit 56c491c0e27e4625b25bfb60ab8d8f2b64f22d6d)
"}]
commit_message:
Add noqa support for H201 (bare except)

This'll be nice to have in high-level exception handlers that really do want
to catch *everything*

For example, Swift has some error handling code that is intended to
prevent exceptions from ever getting back to the user.  Because we
don't know what exception classes a third-party lib might raise
(including ones that might not inherit from Exception), it is not
possible to enumerate all of the possible exceptions so a bare
except: is the only reasonable option.

Change-Id: I4b44185df6b43316446b37225741523c7c829a3f
(cherry picked from commit 56c491c0e27e4625b25bfb60ab8d8f2b64f22d6d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/23/82223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
def hacking_except_format(logical_line, physical_line): Okay: try:
 pass
except: # noqa
 pass if pep8.noqa(physical_line): return

commit_message:
Using resolving properties for update

For definition reference in template we should use built-in functions.
So template after parsing with resolve_static_data will contain
references on these functions instead resolve values.
If we want get some information about previous state of stack during
update, we should use self.properties instead of self.t['Properties'].
Also default=[] was added to avoid error when we try to do set([]).

Closes-bug: #1292495
Change-Id: I0cc44a0a541913cca665caec1a7f3a2a1a6cebc9

commit_message:
add pooling for cache references

Change-Id: Iffb1d1bff5dc4437544a5aefef3bca0e5b17cc81
Closes-Bug: 1289074
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/78/81078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import contextlib # Token caching self._cache_pool = None self._cache_initialized = False self._cache_pool = CachePool( env.get(self._conf_get('cache')), self._conf_get('memcached_servers')) if token_id: with self._cache_pool.reserve() as cache: serialized = cache.get(key) with self._cache_pool.reserve() as cache: raw_cached = cache.get(cache_key) with self._cache_pool.reserve() as cache: cache.set(cache_key, data_to_store, time=self.token_cache_time) self.LOG.debug('Storing token in cache') self._cache_store(token_id, (data, expires)) self.LOG.debug('Marking token as unauthorized in cache') self._cache_store(token_id, 'invalid')class CachePool(list): """A lazy pool of cache references.""" def __init__(self, cache, memcached_servers): self._environment_cache = cache self._memcached_servers = memcached_servers def _create_client(self): if self._environment_cache is not None: # use the cache from the upstream filter return self._environment_cache # use Keystone memcache return memorycache.get_client(self._memcached_servers) @contextlib.contextmanager def reserve(self): """Context manager to manage a pooled cache reference.""" try: c = self.pop() except IndexError: # the pool is empty, so we need to create a new client c = self._create_client() try: yield c finally: self.append(c)
deleted_lines: # Token caching via memcache self._cache = None self._cache_initialized = False # cache already initialized? cache = self._conf_get('cache') memcache_servers = self._conf_get('memcached_servers') if cache and env.get(cache) is not None: # use the cache from the upstream filter self.LOG.info('Using %s memcache for caching token', cache) self._cache = env.get(cache) else: # use Keystone memcache self._cache = memorycache.get_client(memcache_servers) if self._cache and token_id: serialized = self._cache.get(key) raw_cached = self._cache.get(cache_key) self._cache.set(cache_key, data_to_store, time=self.token_cache_time) if self._cache: self.LOG.debug('Storing token in memcache') self._cache_store(token_id, (data, expires)) if self._cache: self.LOG.debug( 'Marking token as unauthorized in memcache') self._cache_store(token_id, 'invalid')

commit_message:
Adding support for multiple hypervisor versions

This is to prevent instances with newer tools from being provisioned
on older hypervisors.
Added comparison of hypervisor version from the compute-node and image
metadata in the image properties filter.
In host scheduler image_prop_filter, the 'hypervisor_version_requires'
image properties, if available, is compared to the host_state's
hypervisor_version, if available.
hypervisor_version_requires should be added on the image as metadata and
should have a operator and version value.
Examples : ">=6.0", ">6.0, <6.2", ""!=6.1"

Partially Implements blueprint xen-support-for-hypervisor-versions
Cell scheduler changes coming up in another commit.
DocImpact

(cherry picked from commit a52259ea2dda742d528723d58f20b3b225f1eac5)

commit_message:
Change set_console_mode() to use greenthreads

This method now uses a worker thread to set the console mode asynchronously
similarly to several other methods.

Followup patch to changes Ia707766855bd7ec47a5af05e119b126504ddc0b1 and
Ie03afd66d365e48c9dc3dc48f31e93a08e07e79f.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>

Change-Id: I96d4214ba86f2b1d489b5120c379adfca28a0a7d
Partial-Bug: #1285507

commit_message:
Skip child process kills in stack.sh exit trap

Logs are still being cut off in certain circumstances, almost certainly
because the awk process handling the output for verbose logging to a file
dies/is killed early.

Don't kill child processes in the EXIT trap function in this specific case.

Change-Id: I89600b61d59f87e93ff959710d0169e49d2c9845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/53/82153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Override 'savanna' strings in openstack/common

We are deferring a sync with oslo at this time, so the 'savanna'
references generated indirectly via the project name must be
changed manually.

subject: Add support for parallel testr workers in Keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-10 06:05:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/f4b69a1107c6b272ccb3792848c0ecc5812bdf7f', 'message': 'Add support for parallel testr workers in Keystone

Add support for parallel testr workers in Keystone. This change
forces an override of the SQLite DB path for tests to use a
per-worker (based on PID) temp directory. The keystoneclient,
keystoneclient_sql, and certficate setup tests are grouped onto
a single worker to limit edge cases and limit the amount of
external (keystoneclient library) downloading.

Support to "unset" an overrid using self.reset_opt_in_group has
been added to allow for checking the configuration option behaviors
that touch the database.connection option (e.g. test_config and
ensuring the deprecated sql 'connection' options continue to
work).

For non-SQLite databases to be used, in .testr.conf the
'test_run_concurrency' line must be uncommented, as the support
to handle on-demand postgres, mysql, etc databases to be created
will come in a subsequent change.  Currently non-sqlite databases
cannot be used in tests with parallel testr workers.

partial-bug: #1240052

commit_message:
Add support for parallel testr workers in Keystone

Full support for parallel testr workers now works in keystone. The
major item to be aware of is that if non-SQLite backends or a LIVE
LDAP backend is being used for testing, the concurrency must be set
to 1 to avoid conflicts. To artificially set the concurrency set
the env variable ``TEST_RUN_CONCURRENCY`` to the desired number of
testr workers. The default is to run one worker. To use 1 per
available core, set ``TEST_RUN_CONCURRENCY`` to 0.

Each worker uses a subdirectory of the test temp dir  based upon
the PID. When the worker exists (via the use of atexit), the
worker-specific PID directory is automatically removed.

The first time concurrent tests are run in a given environment,
ensure that old .testrepository directories are cleaned up as they
may introduce bad learning data on how to bin the tests based upon
test runs that occured without concurrency.

Closes-Bug: #1240052
Change-Id: I5c3385a431774ce574266a82065ed6237e8b3665
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/70/65870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The Jenkins job for horizon-upstream-translation-update expects that

If you run the commands from the slave-script, it will update .tx/config

commit_message:
Update .tx/config with type of files

The Jenkins job for horizon-upstream-translation-update expects that
.tx/config is setup properly. .tx/config is the transifex configuration
file that is used for interaction with transifix.com for translation of
the strings.

If you run the commands from the slave-script, it will update .tx/config
with information about the type of the files (PO-files). This change is
not needed and will break the periodic import script for horizon (which
does not exist).

Note that the slave-script needs a fix to work as well, will fix it in
the config repository. Also, the import script needs to be done.

Reference for jenkins job:
https://jenkins.openstack.org/view/All/job/horizon-upstream-translation-update/lastBuild/

Reference to slave-script:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/config/tree/modules/jenkins/files/slave_scripts/upstream_translation_horizon.sh

Change-Id: I9fb6799c8555487941967c2102e1d89c2530b60b

commit_message:
Refactor Tempest installation directories structure

For each deployment Tempest should be installed in directory
"~/.rally/tempest/for-deployment-*deploy_id*".
Also tempest.conf should be stored in this directory.

blueprint tempest-verification

Change-Id: Ieb16e1e32599ee3f3041f04c6ab31f4013d44590
